column4: hey everyone, i'm trying to get my sound working, been trying all day with no luck, i'm using snd-hda-intel, and it appears like it should be working, but is not, i've tried everything i could find, via the forums, etc, please help
if you launch alsamixer, everything looks alright?
yes, everything appears in good order
nothing muted?
nope
aplay /usr/share/sounds/login.wav
it says playing, and no errors, but no sound either
you never got it to work?
I didn't know how to turn off acpi at boot
maybe you should try it, what sound card model?
intel 82801g
no more ideas sorry, maybe worth to give that noacpi flag a test
how do i do that?
when in the bootloader, you can edit a configuration, and then a line, with e, and try appending noacpi to the kernel one
ok i'll try it
thanks
another option, is disabling it in your BIOS
you tried deactivating using the bios? not using kernel boot parameters
if i deactivate acpi, it works, but apparently if i edit dsdt and recompile the kernel, acpi should work according to what i read
nope, sorry
patching the dtst is not really easy
i've read that it's kind of tough, but wasn't sure if anyone had any ideas
